page.title: 16TOURISM AND LANDSCAPE
page.content: {BRIGHTLINGSEA BEACH. A small pebbly beach lies on the East side of the Colne estuary. It attracts little tourist trade compared with Clacton, Walton and Frinton further along the coast. However, its lack of commercialism has considerable appeal. On the beach, a large area has been enclosed to form a safe paddling pool for little children. This is necessary because, at low tide, wide areas of mud are exposed, and at high tide, currents can be dangerous. { THE COLNE ESTUARY}offers a wide open landscape of water, mud flats and marshes from which the farmland rises gradually to low hills. Numerous yachts take advantage of the creeks and open sea to the south, whilst small cargo ships bound for Colchester Hythe, Rowhedge and Wivenhoe wait for the tide to turn.
